doc.after: The radial engine is a reciprocating type internal combustion engine configuration in which the cylinders radiate outward from a central crankcase like the spokes of a wheel It resembles a stylized star when viewed from the front and is called a star engine German Sternmotor French moteur en toile in some languages The radial configuration was very commonly used for aircraft engines before turbine engines became predominant
